data.title: why VisibilityNotifier2D emit signal exit_screen when freed?
data.body:

MAC
2.1.4 beta

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
when the position of the VisibilityNotifier2D node is out of the screen, the exit_screen is emitted, that's OK.
However when queue_free is called on the VisibilityNotifier2D, the exit_screen is also emitted, How to distinguish these two situations in the exit_screen callback?
**Steps to reproduce:**

data.title: Stretch ratio spinbox/slider on Control nodes doesn't work as expected.
data.body:
Debian 64 bit, 3.0 alpha 1

In any control node, in the properties under "Size Flags" there is the "Stretch Ratio" option. The spinbox doesn't increment. Entering a number with the keyboard results in the spinbox displaying that number minus 1. The slider also doesn't work as expected. Clicking on it will display a number in the spinbox, but dragging doesn't changed the displayed value. If you use one of these methods to get the value higher than 1, the spinbox will decrement as expected.

Played with and found that the functionality appears to be fine. It's just the UI input.

**Steps to reproduce:** Add any node that inherits from Control and try to use the Stretch Ratio option.

data.title: Triplanar mapping does not work if s3tc compression is disabled
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**

Win10 (960m and gtx560ti)

**Issue description:**
If s3tc texture compression is disabled in the project settings>rendering>vram compression>Import s3tc, triplanar mapping in a spatial material no longer works.

Not sure if this is a requirement for triplanar mapping for some reason, but it seems like a bug? Note that standard UV mapping works fine without  the s3tc option. Also triplanar works fine without Etc2.

The first image shows the result of turning off s3tc compression and trying to use triplanar mapping:
![triplanar_bug1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7741669/29698581-d8f9d4c4-8999-11e7-9421-474b289fe528.jpg)

If the 3tc option is turned on in the project settings (and the import folder updates with a 3tc texture) the triplanar now works:
![triplanar_bug2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7741669/29698629-5343d28e-899a-11e7-809b-2d3d357056e9.jpg)




**Steps to reproduce:**

- start a new project
- disable the s3tc and Etc2 compression settings
- create a cube mesh
- create a new spatial material, import an image into the albedo and switch the uv1 to use triplanar mapping


**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
[triplanar_bug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1250766/triplanar_bug.zip)

data.title: Fixed several memory leaks
data.body:
From the leaks I found through `valgrind`, there's one last I haven't figured how to fix:

```
==27531== 12,096 bytes in 56 blocks are definitely lost in loss record 847 of 858
==27531==    at 0x4C2BE7F: malloc (in /usr/lib/valgrind/vgpreload_memcheck-amd64-linux.so)
==27531==    by 0x17B1CD1: Memory::alloc_static(unsigned long, bool) (memory.cpp:62)
==27531==    by 0x6D8C39: RasterizerStorageGLES3::texture_create() (rasterizer_storage_gles3.cpp:587)
==27531==    by 0x14BEF6F: VisualServerWrapMT::textureallocn() (visual_server_wrap_mt.h:81)
==27531==    by 0x14B3586: CommandQueueMT::CommandRet0<VisualServerWrapMT, int (VisualServerWrapMT::*)(), int>::call() (command_queue_mt.h:241)
==27531==    by 0x14B058C: flush_one (command_queue_mt.h:671)
==27531==    by 0x14B058C: flush_all (command_queue_mt.h:1329)
==27531==    by 0x14B058C: VisualServerWrapMT::sync() (visual_server_wrap_mt.cpp:106)
==27531==    by 0x2A92FA: Main::iteration() (main.cpp:1572)
==27531==    by 0x2A2730: OS_X11::run() (os_x11.cpp:2125)
==27531==    by 0x29BDAB: main (godot_x11.cpp:52)
```

This is the leak summary of this pull request after just opening and closing the editor:

```

==27531==      possibly lost: 4,630,192 bytes in 69 blocks
==27531==    still reachable: 238,132 bytes in 4,475 blocks
==27531==         suppressed: 0 bytes in 0 blocks
```

data.title: Allow to disable shadow gradients in Light2D
data.body:
Currently the shadow gradient can't be disabled and always has a minimum value of 1.
I'm not sure why though, the default value seems to be 0 and the rasterizer checks for 0 [here](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/8fc6bb8f771c520c15320c3b4be561abc648d65d/drivers/gles3/rasterizer_canvas_gles3.cpp#L1284) before enabling it.

Feels like a bug to me, but if there's a reason for that let me know.

As a side effect, this edit effectively changes the default value from 1 to 0.

data.title: would be nice to have exclude groups for canvas modulate
Proposal for modified Polygon2D editor controls
data.body:
This is probably highly controversial, still I hope this might be useful in some way.

This is an experiment that tries to add editing to Polygon2d that should be more familiar to people coming from Illustrator or Affinity Designer. Changes are: selectable nodes, deleting nodes by pressing the "del" key (deletes currently selected node or the last node while creating the polygon), adding nodes by simply clicking into the edge. Right click to delete still works.

Demo gifs:

![create](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11859538/29683520-edc317f2-890e-11e7-9ad2-617c26ab329e.gif)

![editing](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11859538/29683526-f4491112-890e-11e7-905f-8f43666db077.gif)

data.title: Clicking connection or group icon only half-selects node
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Windows 10 64-bit, Godot 3.0 Alpha1, NVIDIA GTX 1060

**Issue description:** **Steps to reproduce:**
Clicking on a node's connection or group icon in the Scene panel highlights the node as selected, and is visibly selected in the editor, but the Inspector and Node panels still show properties and options for the previously selected node.

data.title: Dynamic Font doesn't appear at default size 16
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Windows 10 64-bit, Godot Alpha1 3.0, NVIDIA GTX 1060

**Issue description:**
At least for Roboto.ttf (in attached project), a label with Custom Dynamic Font does not appear if 16 is the value in the Dynamic Font field. Each other size worked as expected. Editor crashed twice just switching between the different font sizes, which may or may not be related.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a label, check the Custom Font checkbox, set it to Dynamic Font, set Roboto.ttf to be the Dynamic Font Data for it. Set size property in Dynamic Font to be 16.

**Link to minimal example
[godot3Alpha1_fontsize_bug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1249792/godot3Alpha1_fontsize_bug.zip)
 project:**

data.title: Adds realtime updates to polygon 2d editing
data.body: **UPDATE** The new behavior implemented here (see discussion under #10639) is to display a (contrasted) outline while changing the polygon in realtime. Example: ![outline](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11859538/29740453-7140d6ca-8a57-11e7-994f-0d89a06c7a89.gif) There's also a new editor setting that allows for disabling the display of this outline: **ORIGINAL** This is a very small change that adds realtime updates to polygon 2d editing. I'm not sure if this is desirable for all users of Godot. If not, I'd suggest adding an option to enable this. I personally find this much more usable than the current editing. I'm wondering if this is something other users find useful too. Here's a comparison of the current vs the modified behavior. Current: ![current](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11859538/29678254-219ca540-88fe-11e7-90ec-47f9abcd83b3.gif) Modified: ![realtime](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11859538/29678274-33509fb2-88fe-11e7-88c7-2995ad0116a2.gif)

data.title: Show proper string with InputEvent.as_text()
data.body: it's an empty string currently.

data.title: Support .net rather than mono for c#
Improve integration of tool Nodes and AutoLoad singleton objects
data.body:
1. Create scene
2. Add a Node
3. Add a simple tool script to it
```
tool
extends Node

export(Texture) var player_sprite
export(int) var health_points
```
4. The exported vars are visible in the Inspector
5. Create unattached script global_singleton:
```
extends Object

func some_global_method():
    print('Called global method')
```
6. Add it to AutoLoad scripts in Project Settings
7. Append next code to your Node script:
```
func some_method_using_singleton():
    global_singleton.some_global_method()
```
**Actual result:**
The exported vars are gone from the editor and the Node is in fact no longer a tool

**Expected:**
The Node tool mode persists

data.title: Ignore gprof output files
data.body:
When building a profile build it is easy to accidentally create gmon.out
files all over the place. Ignore these so they won't get accidentally
pushed.

data.title: weird color with Force Vertex Shading option on
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Godot 3.0 05a678534433997c71f542ae1b3cecd35abde298
Ubuntu 16.04 with nVidia gtx 670, Android 7.0 galaxy s8+

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8281454/29673468-3b89da50-892a-11e7-9e2a-c6103fb68ec1.png)
for mobile, **Force Vertex Shading** is off by default for performance.
I got the same result on PC with this option on.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Turn on Force Vertex Shading at Project Settings > General > Rendering > Quality.
And run the project.

data.title: can't run project with command line on Mac (EXC_BAD_ACCESS in EditorFileSystem::_save_filesystem_cache)
data.body:
I can't run a godot project directly current master on Mac.
90c7ee38

stack:
```
godot.osx.tools.64!EditorFileSystem::_save_filesystem_cache(EditorFileSystemDirectory*, FileAccess*) (/Users/timo/Documents/Godot/_GodotDev/godot/editor/editor_file_system.cpp:1035)
godot.osx.tools.64!EditorFileSystem::_scan_filesystem() (/Users/timo/Documents/Godot/_GodotDev/godot/editor/editor_file_system.cpp:277)
godot.osx.tools.64!EditorFileSystem::_thread_func(void*) (/Users/timo/Documents/Godot/_GodotDev/godot/editor/editor_file_system.cpp:296)
godot.osx.tools.64!ThreadPosix::thread_callback(void*) (/Users/timo/Documents/Godot/_GodotDev/godot/drivers/unix/thread_posix.cpp:58)
libsystem_pthread.dylib!_pthread_body (/Unknown Source:0)
libsystem_pthread.dylib!_pthread_start (/Unknown Source:0)
libsystem_pthread.dylib!thread_start (/Unknown Source:0)
```

It works to start the project manager and I also can open projects.
I just cannot start it via command line:

`${workspaceRoot}/bin/godot.osx.tools.64 --editor --path /Users/timo/Documents/Godot/DalyMini1_ballJumpAndRun`

data.title: more efficient atlas packing algorithm
data.body:
I changed the atlas packing algorithm.

Atlas before: 
![atlas_before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177068/29662239-40661eae-88cf-11e7-8ba9-50298e25ba08.png)

Atlas after: 
![atlas_after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177068/29662250-48ce5cc8-88cf-11e7-9945-a7aaad7c33a4.png)

We can reach even more efficiency if we able to rotate the images. But I don't know is it possible.

data.title: Auto completion improvement: type-checked scope.
data.body:
**Issue description:**
It would be great if the auto completion adapt to type checked scope:
```gdscript
if event is InputEventMouseButton:
    #in this indentation we know that type of event is not InputEvent but InputEvenMouseButton
    event.   #should now give auto completion for InpotEventMouseButton like button_index.

```
This also would be cool in many other cases when there is an undefined variable and you want to get auto complete. And u as a user know what it probably will be most of the time.

It also would be nice to have swift like syntax augar:
`(my_node is Button)?.set_visisble(false)`
For
```
if my_node is Button:
    my_node.set_visible(false)
```

data.title: Script editor: fixed no key repeat for CTRL+Y
data.body:
TextEdit::_gui_input did not handle KEY_Y, causing the event to get handled elsewhere where key repeat is not handled.

Fixes #10596
